Duh. There are twice as many ortho positions as para positions so ortho is statistically favored. Also formed is the nitramide which in acid rearranges ortho. Nitration of Aspirin the initial sulfuric sulfonates the ring stabilizing the phenol to oxidation by nitric a. Both ortho and para are differently acidic with the dinitroacetanilide being even more acidic. A short Alumina column would separate them easily. One trick for whiter crystals is treating solution with activated charcoal before crystalization.

Downside to growing up: I still think for a split second, "I have money now! That looks like an amazing hobby!" also, (sorry this is an after thought) I"m curious if using Nickle as a catalyst in this particular reaction might enhance the yield?

From a purely mechanical observation: Your "final product" after being ground in mortar in pestle was FAR too course. I can't speak to the purity of either your product, or your reagent by this video. Your synthesis is sound, however I"m not sure ambient temps, and humidity were considered, and since some of the reactions involved in, synthesizing the components of this reaction are very temp sensitive; elevation (or for contained apparatus' pressure) must also be considered.

third year chemistry student here. i've been watching reaction videos like this for years now, since before i started university and i'm just now understanding how these reactions are taking place.

Do at all feel any responsibility for the knowledge which you're so willingly giving out to and audience who may or may not be responsible?

To quote a couple of characters from films that come to mind...

First quote is a bit cheesy but relevant...

"Uncle Ben": With great power comes great responsibility.

And the second which I feel touches closer to the issue;

Dr. Ian Malcolm: If I may... Um, I'll tell you the problem with the scientific power that you're using here. It didn't require any discipline to attain it. You read what others had done and you took the next step. You didn't earn the knowledge for yourselves, so you don't take any responsibility for it. You stood on the shoulders of geniuses to accomplish something as fast as you could, and before you even knew what you had, you patented it, and packaged it, and slapped it on a plastic lunchbox... And your scientists were so preoccupied with whether or not they could that they didn't stop to think if they should.

I say this as terrorist plots from members like ISIS don't worry me as they're watched by drones and may or may not actually be created by the CIA. What worries me is some kid in his bedroom pumped on stims and feeling disgruntled with the mainstream media lifestyle all the while having suicidal and/or homicidal tendencies.

"Oh, here you go kid, this is how you make explosives; but don't try it yeah.... It's only for informational purposes".

Now don't get me wrong, I do feel information should be free of monetary cost but at the same time, I do believe such sensitive information should be earned through hard sweat of the mind after voluntarily going to college and deciding to use said knowledge in a responsible manner.
I do often feel at times that the posting of such videos is the equivalent of being able to by a gun at wall-mart where they just hand them out to anyone with enough money.

Consider it food for philosophical thought. I'd be curious to hear well thought out responses. :)

Hi ! Thanks i use to perform this experiment in my PG as lab excercise. Method which  was prescribed in our lab manual for hydrolysis of p-nitroacetanilide was bit tedious and yield was also unsatisfactory.
Your method is comparatively easier and seems to provide much better results ! However, i would like to point that temperature of Acetanilide- Glacial acetic acid mix. reached upto 20 deg. Centigrade which is responsible for formation of o- nitro acetanilide and o - nitro aniline upto significant. However, if u manage to keep temp. during nitration below 10 deg. C  formation of o isomer would be very less becos formation of o-isomer requires compratively high temp. so carrying out nitration below 10 deg. C i m pretty sure it will help u !
